snippet: Prosecutors say they may seek murder charges against a man accused of abducting three women, saying he forced at least one of them to miscarry.
abstract: Prosecutors in Cleveland say they may seek murder charges against Ariel Castro, accused of abducting Amanda Berry, Gina DeJesus and Michelle Knight, saying he forced at least one of them to miscarry; say charges could be grounds for seeking death penalty; bail for Castro is set at $8 million.

byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and STEVEN YACCINO
byline.contributor: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Serge F. Kovaleski contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Prosecutors say they may seek murder charges against a man accused of abducting three women, saying he forced at least one of them to miscarry.

headline.seo: Death Penalty Possible in Cleveland Abduction Case
headline.main: Officials, Citing Miscarriages, Weigh Death Penalty in Ohio Case
headline.print_headline: Officials, Citing Miscarriages, Weigh Death Penalty in Ohio Case
